Bowling Solitaire was designed by Sid Sackson and published on his A Gamut of Games. According to him, he created this game because of his distaste for solitaire games in which a red 9 is placed on a black 10.

In this game, standard playing cards are used to simulate a round of bowling.

25315.name: Schneckenrennen
25315.description:
Which snail will win the exciting race, roll the right colors on their dice and reach the goal first? Watch out: Not only speed counts! If you run too fast you can easily stumble and get a knot on you snail's tail... and that costs time! Therefore remember, dear snail, that more haste makes less speed, and be careful so that you reach your goal safely.

Or, as they would say in Germany:

Welche Schnecke wird wohl das spannende Rennen gewinnen, die richtige Farbe würfeln und als erste ans Ziel gelangen? Doch aufgepasst: Nich nur die Geschwindigkeit zählt! Denn wer zu schnell läuft, kann leicht stolpern und einen Knoten in seinen Schneckenschwanz bekommen... und das kostet Zeit! Darum, liebe Schnecke, eile mit Weile und Bedacht, damit du heil am Ziel ankommst.

25316.name: Black Americans of Achievement: The Game
25316.description:
This question and answer style game is played by groups of two to six. Players/partners "bet" on the success of the answers with points. The objective: answer your question correctly or guess whether another landing player will answer his or her question correctly, winning or losing points accordingly.

This game presents very positive role models in a way that heightens one's awareness of the achievements of Black Americans. Be inspired by the triumphs and struggles of both celebrated and unheralded Black Achievers who are part of this heritage of American success.

25317.name: Unter Uns
25317.description:
This game is the graduation work of a student of visual communication in Weimar.
In the game players assume the roles of illegal immigrants trying to acquire a German passport while living from illegal work and evading the police.

Home Page: http://www.keinpasskeinspass.de/

25318.name: The Little Wooden Train Game
25318.description:
translated from Dutch cover:
Choo Choo, The train is about to leave!

All aboard? The passengers have lost their luggage at different stations and the players have to help them find their luggage. This is achieved by traveling by train from station to station. Good memory may help you find your luggage. The player who is the first to find his or her three pieces of luggage wins.

25319.name: Roars of Laughter
25319.description:
It's a set of ninety cards in two categories: questions and answers. From the box, it's a "merry question and answer card game for merry parties".

The questions begin with "What would you do if...". The answers are along the lines of "I would soak it in milk".

25320.description:
Where's Wally? The Game is based on the Where's Wally books by Martin Handford who also designed this game.

The game is played by using a spinner and counters around a fixed board.

Aim: The aim of the game is to be the first player to reach the designated finishing place (in this case a large question mark) To achieve this, players must complete a series of observational questions outlined on the cards using the picture boards included.
25320.name: Where's Wally? The Game

25321.name: Placar
25321.description: This game simulates a soccer match. Two players roll dice, moves your teams and try to mark the biggest number of goals.

25322.name: The Nobel Game
25322.description: A Snakes and Ladders type game with humorous (but somewhat realistic) depictions of the steps in a scientific career. Players roll a six-sided die and move along the path from birth to the Nobel prize. Good rolls move you ahead fast, poor rolls give you long detours or move you backwards. Ironically (or not!) this game to win the Nobel prize requires no skill. Published by the Nobel Prize Museum in Stockholm, in honor of the 2001 centennial of the Nobel prize.

25323.name: Casey Jones Game Box
25323.description: The Casey Jones Game Box contains three games: Blow the Whistle, Capital Run, and Freight Train. All games are played with a single die, and (at most) 20 train cars. Blow the Whistle is a simple race game for two players, playable by children as young as three-years-old. Players roll and move, with the requirement that they make horn sounds at certain points in the game. The first player to reach the finish line wins. Capital Run is a game for older children, with up to four players. This game also has a roll-and-move mechanic, and players must successfully name state capitals in order to earn a turn, with the object to cross the country on a preset path. Freight train is light but nontrivial game for two players, requiring players to assemble a set of different types of trains. These trains (coal tender, box car, flat car, cattle car) begin the game on preset spaces, and players must roll around the board and assemble their set. There are several opportunities for decisions.

25324.name: Safely Home
25324.description: The object of the game is to travel from school through the neighborhood and arrive home safely with the most Safety Tokens. Along the way, players encounter real life situations that require safe and smart decision making. Opportunities to earn Safety Tokens by using code words, "Safe Spot" locations and buddying up present themselves with every turn, as well as opportunities to say "No" to the dangerous "Stranger". The more advanced version of the game utilizes Safety Situation cards, extra chances to earn Safety Tokens and emphasize the rules of personal safety.

25325.name: Davy Crockett Adventures
25325.description:
Walt Disney's Davy Crockett Adventures, basically each player tries to collect all four Davy Crockett adventure cards onto his playing rack.
These consist of: 'Davy Grins the Bear' , 'Davy Fights Redstick' ,'Davy Goes to Congress' , and 'Davy at the Alamo'
This collection process involves the spinning of a spinner (which is a picture of Fess Parker as Davy Crockett holding a rifle) when the rifle points to one of the adventure cards it is yours. The only catch is that you have to collect the adventures in the order that they happened.

25326.name: The Singing Bone
25326.description:
Who Will Try to Slay the Dragon First? The object is to be the first player to slay the dragon. Players use a spinner to move. They are trying to collect enough "Dragon Cards" (20)so that they can enter the "Dragons Secret Cave". Once in the cave players do battle with the Dragon by spinning the spinner if you spin the number "one" the Dragon is has been slain, any other number and you have to make another round through the cave and try again.

This is based on one of the episodes in the movie The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm.

25327.name: The Adventures of Popeye
25327.description: Object: Four different Popeye Adventures are illustrated on the board. The object of play is for the player to win each of the four adventures by "eating" enough cans of spinach (wooden green discs), which are won in the "Grand Spinach Lottery". After winning an adventure the player receives an Adventure Card. The first player to win all four Adventure Cards and get to the finish is the winner of the game. The game has a typical spinner, cards, wooden "cans of spinach", and a "Grand Spinach Lottery" which is a box that you shake tokens out of, the tokens state how many cans of spinach you will receive.

25328.name: Jr. Quarterback Football Game

3136.name: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

25328.description:
from the Box for the Tee Pee Toys version: All the Thrills of a Big Game: Running Plays, Passing Plays, Kick-Offs, Punts, Field Goals, Punt Returns.You are the Quarterback! Choose your own Plays! Follow the rules of football. Players each roll dice, the numbers on the dice refer to sequence tables which determine the results of the play (one player rolls for offense, and the other rolls for defense). Before rolling the offensive player must state whether he is going to run, kick, or pass. The game consists of "Four Quarters" four sets of (20) plays each quarter. The player with the highest score at the end wins.

Alternate version: Jr. Quarterback came with short game board, markers for downs and quarter of play, a cardboard football and a deck of 20 cards with plays. One quarter of play was one complete pass through the 20 plays card deck. Thus, the deck would be gone through twice per half and 4 times to complete one game. The offensive player would select a play. The card would be turned over to reveal the results. Following the rules of football i.e., 4 downs to gain 10 yards, 4 quarters of play, etc.) the ball would move up and down the field based on the play called and the associated gain or loss in yardage on the card associated with the play called. The plays that could be called were "left end", "left tackle", "left guard", "right end", "right tackle", "right guard", "short pass" and "long pass" as well as "punt", "kickoff" and "field goal". Each of the running plays had gains and losses as well as one fumble and a no gain. "Long pass" had four interceptions including one that was returned for a touchdown. "Long pass" also offered a touchdown. Short pass had a higher completion rate than long pass and only two interceptions. Jr. Quarterback is a fun game for two young players and can even be played by one. In my opinion ages elementary or for the adult who likes old school board games from a simpler time. Great game for teaching a young child the basics.

25329.name: Giant Steps
25329.description:
The Object is to be the first player to cross the street on the blue border "GIANT STEPS" and then back again to his colored "Start" space.
Draw cards, do what they say in order to move. The game requires good manners to move, you must say "May I" of the person on the right, if you don't you lose your turn.

25330.name: Barbie's Keys to Fame Game
25330.description: Object: Build up the "Careers" in the 8 pockets of the tray by playing matching Career Cards, numbered 1 to 6. Whoever spins the spinner to point at the matching Gold Key to Fame takes that career and scores for it later. The winner is the player with the highest score after 2 rounds. The game consists of a tray with eight circular slots, a center spinner on the tray which points to the slots and keys, circular "Careers" cards, and Eight gold keys representing each of the careers.

25331.name: Underground Railroad Perilous Journey to Freedom
25331.description: Object: To become the first player to reach freedom in Canada, by answering trivia questions and avoiding the "Patroller" pawn who gets closer for each incorrect answer. Dice are used for only the first turn, after that movement is decided by the trivia cards. The papers inside the box state that there were only 1000 of this game produced.

25332.name: Waifs and Strays
25332.description:
These character/story based trading cards were made for spooky girls who have no interest in those angry little characters the boys seem to gravitate to. 16 orphaned girls each have their own unique story of how they became orphaned; each lost an object during their difficult time, developed a magic spell and adopted a pet monster. The girls are all somehow later involved in another tragic death. The cards have point values and there is a game that can be played regardless of how many cards have collected. 8 evil puppet cards are included in the full set.

More information:
http://www.therss.com/store/product_info.php?products_id=41&...;osCsid=f295fa51966c4cc1ccb021aaff82597f
http://www.therss.com/creepychristine/

25333.name: Antiquity Trivia Game
25333.description: A trivia game on antiques and collectibles. Questions are given in three levels of difficulty: browser, buff, and advanced collector. Each player chooses a level at the beginning of the game, thus allowing experts to play with beginners. Each card has a relatively easy question (1 point if correct) and a relatively difficult question (2 points if correct). Players announce their intention to answer the easy or difficult question before the next card is revealed. First player to 30 points wins the game.

25334.name: Julma-Juhan piinapenkki
25334.description: A sports trivia game that has been published as some collectible sets. Creator Juha Väätäinen is known as the European Champion of 5000m and 10000m running in 1971.

25336.name: Lapsentekopeli: Tror du på storken
25336.description: This game was published as a teaching material. It is supposed to help create positive feelings about coupling, pregnancy and giving birth.

25337.name: Doctor Who Battles in Time
25337.description:
Doctor Who collectible card game comprising 275 cards to collect, including a scratch 'n' sniff Slitheen card. Released as a partwork each issue includes a pack with 9 cards (8 common and 1 rare).

Also available in booster pack form

The magazine is also a companion guide to the cards, featuring new gameplay rules, tips and tactics, monster fold-outs, episode guides and imagery from the Doctor Who TV series.

25338.name: Coloraddo
25338.description: Dice assigns a color tile, tile color placed on board with matching color but more points awarded for longest pattern (line of the same colors--a "Coloraddo") created from reverse of tile. When tiles are all on the board, the game is over and the winner is the one with the highest score.

25339.name: Trivagory
25339.description: Two types of categories, alphabet and general, make up the 99 different trivia categories. Players try to reach one of the four finish spaces on the center circle and answers the general category question correctly wins.

25340.name: Malcolm in the Middle
25340.description: Players answer questions about the Malcolm in the Middle television show while collecting money for right answers. Wrong answers have the money going to a jackpot. The first player to collect $100 wins.

25341.name: State the Facts
25341.description: Players begin an exciting journey as they take off from any of the six airports on the board. During your tour, you'll be asked questions about the states you visit. Answer correctly and you get a colorful souvenir card for that region you're visiting. Be the first player to collect a souvenir card for all six regions and you're the winner.

25342.name: The Sex Education Game
25342.description:
Players must collect a complete set of 6 male or female sex organ cards. To win with the male organs, he/she must collect 500 million sperm and then land on the motel. To win with the female organs, he/she must also have one unfertilized egg and land on the bedroom.

The male sex organs are:

Snake of Life
Jewel Plum of Naughty Desires
Valve of Relief
Horn of Plenty
Boulevard of Urgency
Sack of Containment

The female sex organs are:

Gates of Forbidden Pleasures
Avenue of Rapture
Digit of Delight
Tube of Sanctuary
Basket of Hidden Danger
Hall of Conception

25343.description: ULTIMA is the lone non-card game included in Robert Abbott's excellent book "Abbott's New Card Games". It uses a chessboard & chess pieces, and is one of the more aberrant chess variants.
25343.name: Ultima

25344.name: 18TN
25344.description:
18TN is Mark Derrick's game set in Tennessee and Kentucky, similar to his 18AL and 18GA. This game is what 1851 was based on, but the substantial changes introduced by Chris Lawson make it play quite differently.

18TN is simple enough to use for teaching the 18xx game system to new players, and finishes in a reasonable time as well.

25345.description:
The game is a commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the area of the "Flensburger Förde", a landscape in the North of Germany.
The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000 Euro. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends and all company cards are sold for their original price.
25345.name: Das Flensburger Förde Spiel

25346.name: Patrol Torpedo (Second Edition)
25346.description:
Patrol Torpedo

Patrol Torpedo is a game representing tactical naval combat between coastal forces during World War II. The player assumes the role of motor torpedo or gun boat skippers and their opponents, up to and including destroyers and other small escort craft.

Game Scale and Conventions


The game is designed to be played using miniature figures and terrain. The game is generally played using figures in the scale of 1/300 or 1/600 scale.

1 turn - 50 Seconds
1 cm - 25 Meters
1 Knot - 1 cm of movement

25347.name: Bahnfahren macht Spaß
25347.description: A game for families with children. The players move around the board, which consists of several pictures of trains and everything involved with them. Whenever a player hits a pictograph, he can draw one card of the 68 travel-cards. If it is a pictograph, it is placed according to its position on the board and the player can move again. Players can move with every pawn and in the end the player with the most travel-cards wins.

25348.name: Bratz Rockin' Chic Board Game
25348.description:
From the back of the box:

Rock to the top! It's a race to stardom at the biggest rock concert of the year! Take a spin to create a stylin' wardrobe! Gather rockin' music and stock up on lots of bling! The right combination will land you onstage, where you win the game- and you rock the spotlight!

25349.name: Gänsemarsch
25349.description:
A children's game, consisting of 32 cards with geese on both sides and a dice. The 32 cards are arranged in a spiral and all players start from the first card. After throwing the dice the player moves accordingly forward on the spiral. If he lands on a card, he has to turn it around and follow its instructions.
The card symbols are sometimes advantageous (e.g. take another turn), sometimes disadvantageous (e.g. sit out one turn). The players can also move other pawns of other players to move them on disadvantageous cards. Therefore it is essential to remember what text is on the backside of the cards.
If two geese meet, one has to follow the orders from the backside of the card, the other must go back to the card where the first goose came from. The player wins, whose goose first passes the last card of the spiral.

25351.name: Spiderrinth
25351.description:
Who will be the first to catch the fly in the middle?

Spiderrinth is a fun and tactical game, where the objective is to be the first to make a trail from one's home field inwards to the fly in the center of the web.

The trail is established by turning the treads and putting chips on the flies. When all the flies from one's home field to the center of the web is covered by a chip, you move your piece onto the prey in the center and thereby win the game - but only if you remember to say "Spiderrinth"!

(From the box - translated from Danish)

25352.name: Mount St. Helens Volcano Game
25352.description: Dice determines how many spaces a player can move on the board. When landing on certain locations a player may accumulate certain points. Only 24 turns are allowed for each player as each round corresponds with an historical milestone leading to the eruption of Mt. Saint Helens on May 19, 1980 (edit: it was May 18th...). It is possible for no player to win the game if all players are still in the red zone after the 24 historical milestones are reached. Each historical milestone may give conditional instructions to players depending on where they are on the board. Also, certain spots on the board may provide additional instructions...or instruct the player to draw from the emergency deck.

25353.name: American Trivia Challenge California Style
25353.description: A player moves ahead on the board with a piece by rolling the die or pair of dice. The landing space has a color. A card of the same color is drawn. If the player can correctly answer the question, the player can throw the dice and move ahead again. Also, the player is given a puzzle piece matching the color/category if the player does not already have that piece. The first player to complete a flag (using the puzzle pieces), return to California and answer a final question, wins.

25354.name: Dinozoo
25354.description: Your rocket ship is a time machine made by Professor Smarty, the world's greatest scientist. He wants you to journey back to the age of dinosaurs to catch the best ones for his new zoo - the DinoZoo. If you do, he will make you Head DinoZookeeper. You get points by catching dinosaurs and getting bonus chips. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

25355.name: All About Savannah
25355.description: An exciting game for all ages about Savannah! Also includes $100 worth of coupons for local businesses!

25356.name: Stoner City
25356.description:
Yet, another Monopoly (q.v.) clone with a marijuana theme. The differences between this and the older game are: players start with $1650 (instead of $1500), it only takes three of this game's version of houses to upgrade to this game's version of a hotel, there is a Police Car token that moves on everybody's turn in the opposite direction of the players. When the Police Car occupies the same space as a player then that player is sent to Rehab (this game's version of Jail).

Includes: Game Board, 5 Player Tokens, Play Money, 36 Kharma Cards, 27 Certificates of Stonership, 1 Police Car, 15 Plant Pieces, 32 Crop Pieces and 2 Stonerware Dice.

25357.name: The 3 Stooges Fun House
25357.description:
This is a children's game with a 3-D board (when the cardboard is properly assembled). The most prominent part of the board is the large slide along one side of the board.

From the box:
"Side Splitting Hi-Jinks with The 3 STOOGES in a Real Zany Fun House!"

25358.description:
Domorino is a color recognition and strategy game. Children create their own set of Dominoes using colored chips and domino frames and think more strategically. The first person who places all of his colored chips wins.

Age: 4+
25358.name: Domorino

25359.name: Pisa
25359.description:
Pisa is a strategy and fine motor skills game. Roll the dice to see how many pieces must be used. Start by building one level and move up to building four. Try to avoid a leaning tower as you carefully place bamboo pieces to support more levels.

Age: 4+

25360.name: Dicey Dunces
25360.description:
From the cover:
"A Pop-O-Matic game for younger children" (ages 4-9)

Dunce hats of four different colors square off by lining up along each edge of the square board with a Pop-O-Matic bubble in the middle.

25361.name: Maselino
25361.description:
Maselino is a game of speed. 40 Colorful bamboo discs are distributed by color to players who pretend they are mice looking for food. The players turn the tiles over until their pictures match. When they do, the players rob the piece of food from the plates in the middle. Only the quickest one can keep it. The winner is the one who gets the most pieces of food.

Age: 4+

25362.name: Scoot!
25362.description:
Scoot is a children's spin-and-move game. Featuring smiling children on the cover, the gameboard is a yard with a winding sidewalk up to the front door of a house. The house stands up for a 3-d game board.

Scoot on home now!

From the front cover:
"New! Fast! Different! Exciting! Fun!"

25363.description:
Battelo is a memory and strategy game. Players move their panda bear through the forest according to the memo tiles they draw and try to be the first to collect 4 different colored leaves in their backpacks.

Age: 4+
25363.name: Battelo

25364.name: Tom and Jerry: Adventures in Blunderland
25364.description: This is a children's roll and move game (actually, spin and move) based on the cartoon Tom and Jerry. Four colored spinners are included with the game. The pieces are cardboard stand-ups for moving around the board.

25365.name: Godfathers & Goodfellas: The Organized Crime Trivia Game
25365.description: "Godfathers & Goodfellas" is a trivia board game that is driven by the popularity of the "wiseguy" genre, particularly in movies and on TV series such as “The Sopranos.” The game consists of a series of categories relevant to the 'mob scene' with questions in each category. The player is a good guy -- a special agent assigned to break up the mob by answering questions. With every correct answer, down goes another bad guy. The harder the question the bigger the bad guy … until the whole gang is gone.

25366.name: Cowboy Riders and Indians
25366.description: This is a very old children's game that has no dice. Instead, there is a large stand-up metal wheel that acts as a spinner. The colorful board shows a single path from an old west town to a fort. The spaces along the path give events of a shootout between cowboys and Indians. (The players are the cowboys.)

25368.name: Avesta!
25368.description: Avesta! is an abstract game themed loosely on the Zend Avesta - the sacred texts of Zoroaster (also called Zarathustra). It is chess-like in the powers and types of moves available, but there are a few spaces on the board that are limited to certain pieces, some pieces are used for blocking only, and some pieces are promoted when others are captured, which can tip the balance, making a capture or sacrifice critical to the outcome. There are two winning conditions: either the capture of the opponent’s offensive pieces, or the defilement (occupation) of your opponent’s temple for a full turn.

25369.name: Clown
25369.description:
Remember the clowns clothes!

Objective for the game:
Try to remember how the clown on the clown card was dressed, and give the clown on the basic card the same clothes before the timer runs out!
The player who has collected the most points after 10 turns wins.

(From the box - translated from Danish)

25370.name: Gift of Enlightenment
25370.description:
From the advertisement:

Gift of Enlightenment is a unique and totally original board game that brings a flow of positive energy to all who discover it. Friends and family will be delighted by its healing messages and fun game play. This is one adventure that is guaranteed to stay in the mind long after the final dice has been thrown.

Game Features: - Seek your very own ‘Gift of Enlightenment’. Make life-changing decisions as you travel the ‘Circle of Life’. Win and lose positive and negative human traits along the way. Harness the energy around you. It can help you to reach the ultimate goal. How powerful are your Sixth Sense, Insight, and Intuition? Here’s your chance to find out as you seek to master the ‘Seven Chakra Challenges’. Collect the Seven Chakra Crystals that can help you to open the wonderful ‘Book of Enlightenment’.

Delve into the mysterious Karma Pool. Try to avoid falling for False Idols. Gain a personal gift from the ‘Book of Enlightenment’.

Each beautifully boxed game contains: -

Game board

7 special Chakra stones with velvet holding bag.

6 Aura cards

3 packs of game cards

42 Chakra crystals (acrylic)

7 Chakra color cards

7 Chakra Challenges.

Wooden Dice

Full Instructions

Plus the 82 page ‘Book of Enlightenment’

25371.name: Little Angels and the Fruit of the Spirit
25371.description:
Little Angels and the Fruit of the Spirit

As players move their little angels along the brightly colored path, they will be introduced to the names and meanings of all nine Fruits of the Spirit from Galatians 5:22.

25372.name: Steward
25372.description:
Steward

In STEWARD, your mission is to manage and multiply the riches that have been entrusted to you.

Great riches are in your hands • What will you do with them

Make different purchase in order to produce olive oil, clay pots, food grains, clothes and more. Buy and export stone to build houses or temples or become the biggest copper producer in your area. Discover the Biblical Principles that will make you a Great Steward! Never forget to tithe on all your income. It will be the key to your prosperity. Use strategy to succeed in the challenge that has been entrusted to you and by doing so become THE BEST STEWARD.

STEWARD • A captivating game that you will certainly enjoy and that will be the source of many unforgettable moments with your family and your friends.

25373.name: Professor Noggin's The Human Body Card Game
25373.description:
Do you wonder about sneezing, saliva or your sense of smell? Ever ponder scabs, snoring or sweat? Then this game, all about YOU, is for you!

Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions. A special three-numbered die is included which creates interaction and promotes communication between players. Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged - while of course having fun!

25374.name: Parts of Speech Challenge!
25374.description:
Parts of Speech Challenge reinforces knowledge of nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, prepositions, pronouns, conjunctions and interjections!
Parts of Speech Challenge helps players master the eight basic parts of speech plus verb phrases, prepositional phrases, articles, and proper nouns. Players learn how the same word can represent different parts of speech based on how it is used in a sentence.
As they move around the board, drawing cards and reading sentences, players identify the parts of speech of selected words. All words are used in sentence context for meaningful learning.
The Reference Sheet, included, allows players to familiarize themselves with the parts of speech. Younger players can use the Reference Sheet while playing the game.
The object is to cover the most spaces on the board before one player runs out of markers. The player with the highest score wins!

25375.name: Il Golpe
25375.description:
Wargame for two players, originally included with issues no. 728, 729 (the regular 6-sided die) and 730 of Italian magazine "Panorama", in spring 1980.

From the rules' sheet:

"Il Golpe, a bespoke creation for "Panorama", is a war game based on a hypothetical military coup in Italy.
The game's flow simulates the typical putsch's mechanics: mutiny of military units, assaults against TV broadcasting stations, airports, nuclear plants and naval bases, riots in the streets.
The game represents a single day of war, consisting in 8 phases of 3 hours each. At the beginning of the game the "rebel" player secretly compiles a list with the opponent's units that will mutiny, then the "government" player places his army and only after this stage is the list revealed. At the end of the game the total value of the "strategic goals" achieved by the "rebel" player is calculated, and if his total score is higher than the "government" player's one (the sum of the objectives still under his control) the coup d'etat is successful."

Contents:
Map of Italy (84 x 39,5 cm) with reference charts embedded;
107 cardboards chits;
1 dice;

25376.name: Safari Yum
25376.description:
A simple and fun dice game for young children! Players roll five dice with animal pictures (lion, monkey, giraffe, crocodile, elephant and hippo) on each side, and try to collect sets of matching animals. The "Lion" picture is "wild". After the first roll, players are allowed to re-roll the dice of their choice up to two times. Players then place the equivalent number of matching animal tokens on their playing board. This process is repeated for each player five times. The winner is the player with the most monkey, giraffe, crocodile, elephant and hippo tokens on their playing board! Suitable for children age 4 and older.

Contents:

4 play boards
100 chips
5 dice
1 dice cup
1 sticker sheet
instructions

25377.name: Hickery Dickery Clock
25377.description:
Hickery Dickery Clock is an easy game for children age 4 and up, about telling time and matching funny faces.

Object: Race against Timothy Mouse by striking each hour of the clock before turning up all 4 Timothy Mouse cards. Players win by matching all the hours on the clock before the last Timothy Mouse card is turned up.

Contents:

5 piece jigsaw game board with clock hands
deck of game cards with clock pictures

25378.name: Mithril
25378.description:
In Mithril, each player plays a team of dwarves exploring a mine to discover buried valuables, such as gold, beer, mithril and a treasure chest. Players must dig carefully to avoid being crushed in a cave-in, as the mines' stability is unpredictable, and the other players can sometimes trigger cave-ins and other hazards.

The game ends when a players brings the treasure chest back to his entrance. Then, the richest player wins the game.

The game is still under development.

25379.name: Flink
25379.description: Flink's unique gameplay combines the fun of shuffleboard with the skill of pool! Using the "Flink sticks", players "flink" discs to be nearest the backboard. Knock your opponent off the board, into the "gutter" and out of play! The player whose disc is closest to the backboard after flinking five discs each wins that round. The player who wins five rounds first has won the game.

25381.name: Stress Strategies
25381.description: Players must think of solutions to the stressful situations that they meet in the game and then discuss the results. Everyone wins in Stress Strategies by listening, sharing, and accepting the feelings and responses of all the players, and by learning healthy ways to manage stress.

25382.name: Nimm uns mit, Jim Knopf!
25382.description: Based on the popular book by Michael Ende. One player takes the role of Jim Knopf, who wants to take as many friends as possible with him in Lukas' - who is played by another player - locomotive Emma. But even in Lummerland - the imaginary island, where the train tracks lead around - you need a ticket to ride the train. And it isn't as easy to get one of those...

25383.name: Sandmann, lieber Sandmann
25383.description:
This is a very simple roll-and-move game from the former East Germany (DDR) -- the game is pictured in the Taschen Icons Book _DDR_Design_. From the appearance in the book, it's a bedtime game for children -- players roll the die and move their piece, and follow the directions when they land on certain spaces -- e.g. move forward, wait for two turns, etc.

John Blund is known in Scandinavian as a mythological little man who calms the children and helps them to sleep.

The goal of the game is to reach the finish point first. Just roll the die and move. If you end up on a "action"-field just follow the simple instructions.

25385.description:
Zzzymble is a card game with five suits, containing the numbers 1-9, plus various special cards that affect gameplay. Players are trying to play their cards into a 5x5 grid. Cards may not be played adjacently (orthogonally or diagonally) to another card that match either number or color. When the grid is full, players sum card values remaining in their hands. Over a number of rounds (playing to 100 points), the winner is the player with the fewest points.

A planned forthcoming expansion is called "It's as Zzzymble as Zzzat."
25385.name: Zzzymble

25387.name: Alpenreise
25387.description:
The board shows the German Alps and the villages and cities situated in that area. The different locations are connected by lines.
The players draw a card and place a flag into the according location. In addition they draw cards from every color on the board, which then represents their travel route. Other cards are telegram cards (describing a special occurrence) and pass cards (which are used to travel over mountains).
The players roll a dice and move accordingly. Whoever manages to visit all his locations and returns to his starting point first, wins.

25388.name: What Will You Find
25388.description: Help Pip & Pop, Tutter and Ojo find their favorite things hidden in Bear's yard. Spin to move ahead. Land on special spaces and turn over Bush tokens to see what's hidden where. Find two of your character's favorite things and reach Bear's house first to win.

25389.name: Anti-Grid
25389.description: Anti-Grid is an abstract strategy game for two players, each trying to eliminate the other’s pieces through capture. The unique thing about the board is that each player plays on his/her own grid - they never follow the same paths to victory or defeat. Capture is made by flanking, or trapping an opponent’s piece between two of your own, and players may set up “barricades” to impede their opponent’s moves (momentarily, anyway). There are two boards included with a larger and a smaller grid, allowing shorter or longer, more challenging games.

25391.name: Double Trouble
25391.description: Each player spins to establish their color. The 24 puzzle pieces are evenly distributed. The red player starts by trying to put the puzzle together while the person on their left is trying to spin red's color. When red is spun, the player spinning tries to put the puzzle together while the person on their left tries to spin that persons color. The first player to use all of their puzzle pieces is the winner.

25392.name: Kiss My Ass
25392.description: Players are dealt all of the cards in the deck and the starting player takes a card from the person on their left. They can either kiss that body part of the person who they took the card from or leave it in their hand. When you lose all of your cards, you are safe. When the next to last player is out of cards the loser is the one holding the Kiss My Ass card.

25393.description: Crazy 8ths is a music based educational card game that introduces many variants to popular card games, and is designed to help children learn to read music.

boardgameversion.31327: TKDesigns edition with 'Dr Toy Best Vacation Children Products' winner sticker

25393.name: Crazy 8ths

25394.name: Mad Gab Mania
25394.description:
Classic Mad Gab goes digital as Mad Gab Mania adds visual and audio clues as well as other challenges that creates a whole new way to play. Programmable Game Buzzers let teams compete head to head for lightning-quick play!

Features:
- Steal points by unscrambling "Scramble Swipes."
- You make the choice and control the game with "Pass or Play."
- If you're behind, you can get help from "The Equalizer."

25395.name: Monopoly: Astronomy
25395.description: Another Monopoly variant. Utilities are replaced by observatories, railroads by telescope manufacturers and properties by celestial bodies. The pewter pieces are: radio telescope, telescope in dome, Hubble Space Telescope, Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, binoculars and lawn chair.

25396.name: Cribbage: The Board Game
25396.description: “Cribbage - The Board Game” is a simple, fast game for anyone who enjoys playing the traditional cribbage card game. Unlike the traditional card game, the board game can only be played with two teams and therefore cannot be played by three players. Fortunately (and uniquely) this cribbage game can be played very well with six players forming two teams of three. Each team alternates play by placing a card on the board from their dealt hand. The board is a five by five grid with a face down card in the center revealed only after all cards are played. At the end of each round one team will score the cribbage “hands” that form the “rows” while the other team scores the cribbage “hands” that form the “columns”. Every card placed will become a card in one of your cribbage “hands” on the board but will also be a card in one of your opponents “hands”. The trick therefore is to strategically place cards in such a way to help yourself but hinder your opponent. The board also has card values printed on some spots for instant scoring. Placing a queen on a spot on the board with a queen printed on it will score an instant two points - just as matching a pair during regular play would in a traditional cribbage game. Placing a five on the same queen spot would similarly score an instant two points for the fifteen. Final scoring is done after all spaces are filled using the same procedure one uses for a traditional cribbage hand. First team to 121 wins. If you like to play cribbage, especially with a group, this is a fun twist on one of the world’s oldest card games.

25397.name: Bok
25397.description: Quoted from the game box: “BOK is a fast paced strategy game that is more demanding and challenging than Backgammon or Chess. Truly a remarkable and intriguing concept, unparalleled in the history of games. BOK will remain unchallenged in years to come as The Ultimate Strategy Game.”

25398.name: Panama
25398.description:
This game is one of the winners of the 2006 Boulogne-Billancourt International Designer Contest.

In Panama, players are mission leaders that strive to complete the first canal joining the Atlantic and Pacific oceans. Three projects are under study: one in Panama itself, another one in Mexico and one in Nicaragua.

To win the game, the players must not only dig the canals, but they must also hire experts, emit lotteries to fund their mission, buy shares in the different projects, and invest wisely in the six resources required when building a canal.

25399.name: Salut les Filles!
25399.description:
Salut Les Filles! must be played within a public area, such as a pub or coffee.

Players play cards describing a physical element that can be found on a person, such as long hair, cell phone, she kisses me, etc...

The first player to spot a person with at least one attribute on a card gets the card and marks a point, other players have to agree if the person corresponds with the card's element.

25400.name: Fictionary
25400.description: A trivia type game where players must move inward along the different color tracks until one player reaches the mortarboard space while trying to figure out definitions to words. The first player who picks the correct definition of the word while on the mortarboard space wins the game.

25401.name: Grabbin' Grasshoppers!
25401.description: Each player takes a net and on the count of three, presses four grasshoppers down on the board as fast as they can. In a few seconds, the suction cups will loosen and the grasshoppers will hop high into the air. The player who catches the most in his or her net wins.

25402.name: Hic!
25402.description: Start by preparing the cheatwell punch (recipe included). Each person turns over one of their cards in front of them trying to find a match on the board between players. When a match is spotted, Snap is called. The two players who match, race to be the first to call their opponent something in the opponent's category beginning with 'A'. The winner of the Snap does not have to drink.

25403.name: The $128,000 Question Game
25403.description:
Players compete in a test of knowledge, trying to win the most money by answering questions in the category of their choice.

Based on the the TV game show, hosted by Mike Darrow (pictured on box) for its first season (1976-77).

25404.name: Creepy Crawlers
25404.description: Take over the house with the help of creepy crawlers bugs. You can play with bugs inside this box, or with bugs you make in your creepy crawlers oven. Players take turns moving, capturing room after room as their bugs swarm through the house. The first player to capture three rooms wins the game.

25405.name: Split the Ward
25405.description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome to the Happy Valley 314th ward! Does it look familiar? We have six nursery classes, two independently running Primaries, and two elders quorums. We’re packed like sardines into our ward building and it’s time to Split the Ward! In this fun, action-packed game, you and your friends and family have been called to help rearrange a cast of zany characters into new leadership positions as quickly as possible. The first person to organize three completed presidencies wins! The action cards and wild cards will keep things interesting and you’ll be surprised at how many of the “peculiar people” in our ward family remind you of someone in your own ward! Find out how much fun it is to Split the Ward!

25406.name: Tell
25406.description: Players form words using cards. They meld them for points starting with a 5 letter word. Three letter words can be added to to form a new word. The first player to reach 5,000 points wins.

25409.name: Salamanca
25409.description:
from Zoch:

In the province of Salamanca, in the heart of Spain, there is plenty of activity. It is the middle of the 16th Century and young, ambitious noble families are reclaiming the dry hinterlands, building fields, forests, and lakes around their castles. Piece by piece - parcel by parcel - their holdings increase. Farmers work the fields, and in especially successful areas, monks found their influential cloisters. But everything happens under the watchful eyes of the nobility. Intrigues are hatched, tax collectors fleece the landowners, and far too often entire tracts of land are lost to locust plagues. Only he who keeps a cool head will become the Duke of Salamanca.

Through clever use of cards in hand, players obtain tiles for placement (buildings, landscapes, privileges) as well as the ability to carry out certain actions. The tiles obtained are placed on tactically important spaces on the game board. Players can also place ownership markers onto buildings. By cleverly placing landscape tiles adjacent to the proper buildings, valuable regions can be formed that will bring in doubloons. Through the actions that can be gained by playing cards, players can bring plague stones (among other things) onto the board, and thereby block their opponents' tiles. The winner is the player with the most doubloons at the end of the game.

25411.description: Take Rudolph's place at the head of Santa's sleigh as you guide the team through adventure-filled skies. Learn to be a leader and to share. Pick up action cards along the way with messages that give children of all ages life-long lessons about teamwork, diversity, consideration and more. Look for Rudolph's red nose to appear magically on select action cards. Be the first to place all your Rudolph gifts under the tree and win.
25411.name: The Original Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer

25412.description:
From White Wolf website:

"There is a World of Darkness much like our own. Hidden from humanity by a veil of deceit, the vampires of this world play games of intrigue, politics and betrayal. You are one of those vampires, called Kindred. Your Prince among the undead has declared that he will go into torpor, the rest of ages, and will choose a successor before he passes. The vampire who wins the support of the most allies before dawn will be declared the new Prince.

Vampire: Dark Influences is a game for two to five devious players who forge bonds, win favors and break vows to reign supreme over the night.

This game includes:

5 different clans of vampires, one for each player
25 Kindred Cards, whose favor is won to claim the throne
30 Event Cards to attack, deceive and stymie opponents
Blood tokens for each clan
One 10-sided die. "
25412.name: Vampire: Dark Influences

boardgamefamily.7757: From RPG books to board games

25413.description: Players start on the letter A space and roll a colored die to determine if they pick a card. If they don't pick a card, they have to name an animal starting with the letter A. They advance to B and repeat the process until either they roll the color yellow, can't name an animal or land on an alpha card box. An advanced version gives each of the six colors on the die a different question that the players must answer.
25413.name: Junior Alpha Animals

25414.name: Mindrubble
25414.description:
Mindrubble is a combination of abstract gaming and trivia games. That is: to make a move on the board, you have to answer a trivia question first. The game has 400 question cards in 3 categories: numbers, cities, people. Furthermore there is a board with a 8x8 grid, containing symbols of the 3 categories and 64 chips, grey on one side, black on the other.

Before starting the game 2 gray and 2 black chips are placed in the middle of the board. If you have 4 players, you'll play in 2 teams. On your turn you place a chip in your color on the board next to one of your opponent. Your goal is to capture your opponents chips.

How is that done? First you try to close your opponents chips in. For that you need to have your chips on both sides of your opponents. This can be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. Then you try and capture the chip(s) by answering a question. When answered correct, the opponents chip(s) are turned over. When answered incorrect, nothing happens and your opponent takes his/her turn.

The game ends when the board is full or when no player can place a chip or when all chips are one color. The player with the most chips up, wins.

25415.name: Bulldogs Away !!
25415.description:
Modern Fast Attack Craft Rules

by David Manley

Current Edition 1.0

36 pages; recommended scale 1/600, 1/700; complexity: 6/10; level of detail: 5/10; avg game length 2 hours; dice required: D20, D10, D6

View Summary of Contents

The rules are for the recreation of small naval engagements with Fast Attack Craft such as missile boats and smaller warships, mainly in coastal waters. The period covered runs from the late 1950’s onwards, and allows also for the use of aircraft and helicopters.

An important aspect of the rules is that the units can start as unidentified “blips”, which might be dummies, and there is a simple detection and identification system that changes the status to “contact” (detected as an enemy vessel) and “target” where the model is deployed. If you can get out of radar “sight” then you can revert to “blip” status again.

The shooting system allows for guns and missiles of various types, and damage is recorded in a graded system with 5 states from intact to sunk. Vessels can take Special hits when damaged which further degrade their ability. There are simple rules for operating helicopters from ships, as well as rules for anti aircraft fire with guns and missiles.

There are also additional rules for unconventional craft, mine warfare and operations against coastal targets.

They are rounded off with extensive data tables for missiles, torpedoes, guns, rockets, SAM systems, Air to Air missiles, ships, helicopters and aircraft. (There are 140 sets of ship data from over 40 countries).

Summary of Contents

INTRODUCTION

SETTING THE SCENE: Vessel Descriptions; Command and Control; Play Area

TURN SEQUENCE AND INITIATIVE

MOVEMENT: Moving Astern; Turning; Collisions; Drifting; Grounding; Towing

TARGET DETECTION AND IDENTIFICATION: Detection / Identification States; Managing “Blips” and other markers; Moving “Blips” and “Contacts”; Notes on Detection and Identification; Radar Detection; Detecting Radar Emissions; Sharing Detection Data; Visual Identification of the Target; Random Visibility; Sharing Identification Data; Starshells and Flares; Countermeasures

FIRING: Weapon Firing Arcs; Eligibility of Targets (Lines of Fire); Gunfire; Missile Fire; Torpedo Fire; Salvo Rocket Launchers and Rocket Pods

DAMAGE: Basic Damage Table; Damage Control

AIRCRAFT AND HELICOPTERS: Altitude; Aircraft and Helicopter Detection and Identification; Surface to Air and Air to Air Fire; Aircraft Damage; Air to Surface Attacks; Launching and Recovering Helicopters

UNCONVENTIONAL CRAFT: Semi Submersibles; Surface Effect Ships; Hydrofoils; Hovercraft; Ekranoplans; Suicide Craft

MINE WARFARE: Types of Mines; Hits on Minelayers; Mine Laying; Detonation; Minesweeping; Mine Hunting; Minesweeping Helicopters

LAND FORCES: Troops; Vehicles; Buildings; Use of Naval Weapons against land targets

TABLE OF ACRONYMS AND ABBREVIATIONS

DATA TABLES: Air to Air Missiles; Anti-Ship Missiles; Guns and Rocket launchers; SAM Systems; Special Craft; Torpedoes (Unguided); Torpedoes (Guided); Bomb Systems; Typical Helicopters; Typical Aircraft; Notes on Ship Data Tables

SHIP DATA TABLES

25416.name: Stick 'em Up
25416.description:
The game consists of a deck of thirty-two oversized playing cards. Each card depicts a sheriff, a gunman or an ordinary cowboy. Each player is dealt a card and looks at it secretly.

When it is a player's turn, that player returns the card to the bottom of the pile and draws another if it is not a gunman or a sheriff. If a player has a gunman, that player can choose to eliminate another player by saying, "Stick 'em Up!" If the chosen player responds by revealing a card whose cowboy doesn't have his hands up that player is eliminated. Responding with a gunman or sheriff eliminates the player who is taking a turn.

If a player reveals a sheriff on his turn, all players holding gunmen are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

boardgamehonor.8848: 2007 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee

25417.description:
This game is based upon Richard Borg's Command and Colors system. The world of BattleLore meshes history and fantasy together - putting players in command of an array of miniature troops on the battlefields of a Medieval Europe Uchronia at the outset of the Hundred Years War.

Drawing on the strengths of Memoir '44, this Days of Wonder game takes the time-tested Command and Colors system to a new level and offers gamers of many backgrounds a chance to fight medieval battles with a dose of epic fantasy.

In this fantastical re-imagining of the Hundred Years War, French and English armies are supplemented with Goblins and Dwarves mercenaries and even some creatures like the Giant Spider and the Earth Elemental! Just as important as the armies you have, though, are the Lore Masters you choose to aid you: Wizards, Clerics, Warriors and Rogues can all aid you with unique powers and spells in ways role-playing gamers will find familiar.

boardgameversion.88401: Fantasy Flight French / English Repurposed Edition

25417.name: BattleLore

25418.name: Paare: Alte und Neue Pinakothek München
25418.description:
A variant of memory where, unlike in the traditional memory game, you don´t have to find cards with the same image on them, but those which were taken out of the same painting or depict the same style of art.

All the images on the cards were taken from paintings and sculptures on display in museums..

The game contains a 28 page guide which gives various information on the 36 artworks depicted on the cards.

25419.name: Super-Wissens-Quiz
25419.description: The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 6600 questions out of 8 different fields of knowledge. Those fields include trivia, fairy tales & myths, technology & science, heaven & earth, history & politics, nature & environment, sports & games and art & culture.

25420.description:
The dream of creating a new civilization in ancient Mesopotamia is within reach. Are you ready to lead your population ?

In the age of its maximum splendor, this vast and fertile geographical area was a scene of destiny for some populations, who resolved to settle in the richest and most strategically advantageous territories. Over the course of centuries these populations succeeded in developing all aspects of their civilization wisely. This was the main factor enabling them to found marvelous cities like Ur and to construct gigantic buildings like Ziggurats.
Just like Mesopotamia’s ancient Kings, each player will have to achieve the highest prestige by precisely dosing the development of Agriculture, Trade, Politics, Culture and finally War, so that thanks to these efforts the long desired construction of five Ziggurats is completed.

But, beware…
If the King becomes guilty of Greed in building them, or pursues improperly the conquest of Lands, this could ultimately lead him to defeat. The intrinsic speed of the game, the simplicity of rules, the very alluring artwork, together with the subtlety of the innumerable strategies which can be pursued, render Ur a gaming experience which you will play and play and keep playing again for a very, very long time!

Online Play


http://www.mabiweb.com/ (turn-based)
25420.name: UR

25421.name: Action Stations! (third edition)
25421.description:
Naval Wargames Rules for Coastal Forces
1914 – 1953

by David Manley

Current Edition 3.2

40 pages; recommended scale 1/600; complexity: 7/10; level of detail: 6/10; avg game length 2 hours; dice required: D10, D6

View Summary of Contents

These rules are designed to fight actions in the First and Second World Wars and the Korean War. They provide the opportunity to re-fight skirmishes in the Channel, the Med and the Pacific with MTB attacks on Convoys and similar furious engagements. They are designed for use with models currently available in various scales, and come complete with a data annexe covering 140 vessels and 90 aircraft. (All that you could possibly wish for in your games.)

Summary of Contents

INTRODUCTION: Scales; Required Material; Model Bases; Conventions; Designer’s Notes

SHIP AND CREW CLASSES: Ship Classes; Damage; Crew Quality; Weather; Weather Change

ORDER OF PLAY: Damage Control Rolls; Initiative and Order of Movement

MOVEMENT: Crash Starting Engines; Drifting; Speed Loss through Hull Damage; ‘Silent’ Engines; Collisions; Running Aground; Towing

VISIBILITY AND DETECTION: Gunfire; ‘Darkened Shores’; ‘Superior Camouflage’; Starshells and Flares; Searchlights; Illuminated Areas; Audio Detection; Smoke Floats; Radar; Dummy Markers

GUN ATTACKS: Determination of Damage and Surprise; Rates of Fire; Changing Targets; Lines of Fire; Firing Procedure; Hit Location; Armour; Effects of Hits; Weapon Hits; Damage Control; Shore Batteries; Weapon Applicability

TORPEDO ATTACKS: Launching Torpedoes; Hitting the Target; Effects of Torpedo Hits; Reloads; Homing Torpedoes; Circling Torpedoes; Stern Launched Torpedoes; Torpedoes in Shallow Water

LAND FORCES: Troops; Vehicles; Buildings; Dock Gates

SUBMARINES: Diving; ASW Attacks; Damage whilst Submerged; Limitations on Submarine Offensive Actions

Q SHIPS: Hidden Weapons; Special Weapons; Special Features; Q Ship Scenarios

MINE WARFARE: Types of Mines; Hits on Minelayers; Mine Laying; Detonation; Minesweeping

AIRCRAFT: Taking Off and Landing; Air to Air Combat; Surface to Air Combat; Air to Surface Combat; Aircraft Damage

SPECIAL RULES: Survivors; Boat Transfers; Sinking Vessels; Holman Projectors; Depth Charge Attacks on Surface Ships; Swamping

WORLD WAR TWO DATA TABLES: Typical Merchant Vessels; British Vessels; German Vessels; Italian Vessels; Japanese Vessels; Russian Vessels; United States Vessels; Minor Nations Vessels; British Aircraft; German Aircraft; Italian Aircraft; Japanese Aircraft; Russian Aircraft; United States Aircraft

WORLD WAR ONE DATA TABLES: World War 1 Vessels; World War 1 Aircraft

REFERENCES; TEMPLATES; LARGE CRAFT DATA SHEET; SMALL CRAFT DATA SHEET

25422.name: Fox Two Reheat!
25422.description:
Air combat 1950 to the Present Day

Current Edition: 1.1

52 pages; recommended scale 1/300, 1/600, 1/700; complexity: 7/10; level of detail: 7/10; avg game length 1-1½ hours; dice required: D10, D6

View Summary of Contents

These rules simulate tactical level jet fighter combat from 1950 to the present day. They are specifically designed for jet versus jet combat and unlike other products that go into too much detail, each player can handle several aircraft. The rules operate in three dimensions while only physically using two, height being indicated beside an aircraft.

There are guns, air to air rockets, Infra Red and Radar guided air to air missiles, SAM sites, etc. Data for over 200 aircraft in use by many nations from the 1950’s onward are included.

The skill of aircrew is very important and the system provides for this. The players can decide how good the crew are by deciding the level of training they think is appropriate, though a random system for skill generation is also provided.

Radar and electronics are handled within the rules by means of a Tech Level system that allows for systems to be improved or obsolete within the game, but without extra complication. Ground attacks are possible as part of the game mission mix, though the effect of the attack will depend on using the right weapon. SAM and AAA sites are also included.

Note

The game rules were developed specifically with jet fighters in mind and the data calculation reflects this. We took a decision NOT to include propeller driven aircraft (with a very few specific exceptions), and this has provoked comment from some users, especially if fighting the Korean war.

Summary of Contents

INTRODUCTION: Scales; Definitions and concepts; Technology Levels; Designers’ Notes

MEN AND MACHINES: Aircrew Training and Skills; Skill Rolls; Dazed, Wounded or Dead Aircrew; Crew Survival; Aircrew Experience; Aircraft Capability; Equipping Stores; Miscellaneous Stores; Jettisoning Stores; Destruction of Aircraft

SETTING UP A GAME, DEPLOYMENT: Points Values; Organizing a Game; Starting the Game; Deploying Surface Targets; Deploying aircraft; Off Table Reserves; Air Superiority Missions; Ground Attack Missions; Intrusion Missions; Interception Missions; Rearming and Repairs; Victory and Defeat

SEQUENCE OF PLAY: Ending the Game; Summary of Crew Activities and Skill Rolls

FLIGHT FUNDAMENTALS: Formations and Movement; The Effect of Altitude on Performance; Speed and Fuel Use; Order of Movement Actions; Movement; Turning; Effects of Damage on Turning; Climbing; Zoom Climb; Climbing Half Loop; Diving; Diving Half Loop; Displacing Models and mid air collisions

GAME ARCS

RADAR AND DETECTION: Contact Markers; Detection—Visual; Detection—Search Radar; Detection of Objects on the Ground; Losing Contact

SHOOTING GUNS AND AIR TO AIR ROCKETS: Guns; Arcs of Fire; Lines of Fire; Target Priority and Timing; Aircrew Shooting; Shooting Procedure; Modifiers; Hitting the Target; Multi-barrel weapons; Automatic Hit Bonus; Ammunition Supply; Damaging the Target; Critical Hits; Effect of Formations on Shooting; Air to Air salvo rockets; AIR-2 Genie air to air nuclear missile

SHOOTING AIR TO AIR MISSILES: Air to Air Missiles; Obtaining a Lock; Losing a Lock; ECM Aircraft; Breaking a Lock; Firing Missiles; Damaging the Target

ATTACKING A SURFACE TARGET: Spotting the Target; Identifying the Target; Attack and Ammunition Types; Attacking an Identified Target; Defensive Fire; Attacking an Unidentified Target; Ground defenses; Unlisted Air to Ground Weapons

GROUND DEFENSES: AAA Guns; Air defense Zones; SAM Batteries

AIRCRAFT DATA: Understanding the Aircraft Data Tables; Filling in the Aircraft Record Sheets; Data for Civilian and Transport Aircraft; Data for Combat Aircraft; Aircraft in Action

TABLES: Payload types and location; Miscellaneous Equipment; Surface to Air Missiles; Air to Air Missiles; Air to Surface Weapons

1 AND 2 SEATER RECORD SHEET; LARGE AIRCRAFT RECORD SHEET

25423.description:
Martian Coasters is an Icehouse game playable with a single Treehouse set, a set of Martian Coasters (each with a colored 3x3 maze printed on it), and a standard d6.

The coasters are arranged in a square and the pieces are placed on differently-colored coasters.

The objective is to move the pieces of your color through the maze printed on the coasters and onto a goal square at the center of your coaster.

The game additionally makes use of the Treehouse die, allowing the players to reorient and move the coasters, creating a constantly changing maze.

The game is also playable by 5, with an expansion coaster. The coaster was sent to the Looney Labs Christmas Mailing List in 2006, and was later made available for sale on the Looney Labs web site.

Also included in Pyramid Arcade as Looney Ludo.
25423.name: Martian Coasters

25424.name: Dice Alley
25424.description:
This is a game with 5d6 where the "poker hand" you roll plus the total of the pips determines how "good" a ball you rolled. If not a strike, you roll all five dice again - if the poker and pips are good enough, you will pick up the spare.

A "five of a kind" is an automatic strike; failing that, a total pip count of 10 or less is a gutter ball.

From the back of the box:
"Finally -- A chance to experience the spine-tingling excitement of the bowling alley without leaving the comfort of your own living room! Hold your breath as you roll the dice -- will it be a Straight for a Strike? Will 2 Pair pick up the Spare? Or will you fall and roll a gutter ball!

Fun for the whole family! Scores just like bowling.

(Shoe rental not required, loud shirts recommended)"

Game Contents: Game result board + four "chips", 5 dice, Rules, and a pad of bowling score sheets with five entries on each.

Item #DA9901

25425.name: The Secret of the Bitter Sweets
25425.description:
(From the back of the game book)

"Invite your friends for an evening of murder and mystery."

"Raquel Bust, star of stage, screen, and the occasional trashy mini-series, has been found dead in her Art Deco dressing room just moments before she was to appear on the Poughkeepsie talk show "Can We Talk?" Who killed her? It could be one of your friends -- or it could be you!"

"Included are complete instructions, invitations, name tags, aliases, complete scripts, alibis, clues, and, of course, the Hidden Solution. The hosts are as much in the dark as the guests... until the murderer is revealed!"

25426.name: Het Grote Bosatlas Spel
25426.description:
Het Grote Bosatlas Spel is a game based on the Bosatlas, the biggest Atlas producer in The Netherlands.

The goal is to answer questions about the six continents in 4 categories: geography, nature, people and records. (In a passport you will score your points and where on the map you've scored them.) ?? If you don't know the answer, you can look it up in the mini Atlas. But only if you're the owner of the Atlas at that time or are capable of taking the Atlas from someone else.

Contents: 1 70x50 cm board, 1 mini-atlas, 1 die, 6 pawns, 1 booklet with 50 passports, 1 pencil, 138 cards, rules.

25427.name: Run Rabbit Run
25427.description:
A game for three-year-olds.
A race to the finish between the farmer and the rabbits. The farmer is trying to catch the rabbits, the rabbits are trying to make it to the other side of the farm. One player is the farmer, the other are the rabbits, if the farmer catches all the rabbits the farmer wins, if one rabbit makes it to the other side of the farm, the rabbit wins.
The rabbits use the carrots spread around the board to hide under, but there's a knack, the farmer can remove from the board a bunch of carrots if he lands on that square and no rabbits are hiding under them.

25428.name: Division Down Under
25428.description:
From the box:

"Match wits with your friends and earn points by pairing equations with their solutions. The player with the most correct pairs wins!"

25429.description:
New Essen 2006 game from Kosmos, based on the German bestseller grammar-book "Der Dativ ist dem Genetiv sein Tod" from Bastian Sick (Spiegel Online).
Each player has to decide if a (German) sentence is grammatically correct or not...
25429.name: Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod

boardgamefamily.21426: Der Dativ ist dem Genitiv sein Tod

25430.name: Wer kennt seine Sachsen?
25430.description: Simple question-and-answer game, circling around the country of Saxony in Germany. The players have to answer questions about the culture, architecture, history/politics, trivia and the country of Saxony. The player, who can answer 9 questions right, wins the game.

25431.description:
From the box:

A game of strategy and tactics where the horror of the future is in the monstrous, cybernetic, hybrids you control! Depend not on luck, but instead, on your mind! A stand alone game where every card counts and no card is useless!

Mandibles is a sub-set of cards playable with any other Terror cards including the basic Terror game system, Terror: Adventures, Terror: Combat, and Terror: Death by Dungeon.
25431.name: Terror

25432.name: Paper Soccer
25432.description:
From wikipedia:

This paper and pencil game starts on an empty field of 8×10 boxes with goals of two boxes wide on the baselines. In the beginning, a virtual ball is placed in the center of the field, on the crossing of the paper lines. Players move the ball in turns and aim to place it in the opponents goal.

In one turn, the ball may be moved into one of the eight paper line crossings around it (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) and a segment from the original position to the new one is drawn to mark the move. The ball may move neither on the game field border nor on the segments marking the past moves but it bounces from them, i.e. a player who moves the ball into a position where there is already an end of a segment or a game field border gets another turn.

The first player to place the ball in the opponents goal wins the game. The game may also end when a player does not have a valid move (he or she loses automatically).

25433.name: Phutball
25433.description:
The game is played using part of the Go board.

The objective is to score goals by using the men (the black stones) to move the football (the white stone) onto or over the opponent's goal line. Player A tries to move the football to rows 19 or 20 and player B to rows 1 or 0. At the start of the game the football is placed on the central point.

Players alternate making moves. A move is either to add a man to any vacant point on the board or to move the ball.

The football is moved by a series of jumps over adjacent men. Each jump is to the first vacant point in a straight line horizontally, vertically, or diagonally over one or more men. The jumped men are then removed from the board (before any subsequent jump occurs). This process repeats for as long as there remain men available to be jumped and the player desires. Jumping is optional, there is no requirement to jump. Note that in contrast to checkers, multiple men in a row are jumped and removed as a group.

25434.name: Sabotage
25434.description:
Sabotage - "A Pocket War Game for two players"

"Sabotage is a game of securing weaponry and attacking strategic buildings, railways, bridges, etc."

Components: There is a small board (lined with felt on the bottom - a nice touch), 3 pawns of a distinct color for each player, red chips, blue chips, 2D6 and a deck of target cards.

The board consists of 3 columns of 8 spaces each. Each column has a blank space on either end (starting spaces), one blue space with a picture of a grenade, one red space with a picture of a bomb, and 4 spaces with a picture of a different target (there are 6 different targets).

You move up and down the columns according to dice rolls (each pawn staying in its column) trying to collect weapons. When two of your tokens land on matching weapon spaces, you collect a weapon - take a blue chip for a grenade and a red chip for a bomb. You collect two weapons (chips) of the appropriate color if you end your movement with all three pawns on spaces picturing the same weapon. If you land on your opponent, send them back to their start space.

Before rolling the dice on your turn, you can turn up a target card. Up to two target cards may be face up at one time. Each card shows a picture of a target and the 'cost' in weapons to successfully attack it. If you don't have the the weapons to successfully attack it, you lose all your weapons. If you 'Double land' (as described to collect weapons) on a target that is face-up, you attack it. You 'pay' the proper weapons to collect the target card. If you turn up a 'sabotage' card, you lose all of your weapons. First to collect 6 target cards wins.

25435.description:
Crimean War Quad: Inkerman - The Soldiers' Battle, 5 November 1854

"Inkerman, 'The Soldier's Battle' is a simulation of the combat occurring between British, French and Russian forces on Inkerman Ridge on 5 November 1854 during the Crimean War. Inkerman is known as the Soldier's Battle because of the lack of higher command during most of the fighting. The game scale is 180 meters per hex ans 30 minutes per Game-Turn."


1 17" x 22" color map
with matte-finish back printed counters
36 Red British
8 Blue French
56 Green Russians divide into 2 commands
14 Game Turn Historical Scenario
21 Game Turn Optional Scenario
25435.name: Inkerman

25436.description:
Crimean War Quad: Balaclava - The Charge of the Light Brigade, 25 October 1854

"Balaclava is a battalion-level simulation of the Crimean War battle that resulted from a Russian attempt to destroy the port of supply for the British forces besieging the Russian fortress of Sevastopol. The battle was fought in the two valleys separated by a ridge north of Balaclava on 25 October 1854. In addition British and Russian units, the British were aided by the Turks and French."


1 17" x 22" color map
with matte-finish back-printed counters
34 Red British
12 Blue French
6 Brown Turks
40 Green Russian
12 Game Turns
25436.name: Balaclava

25437.description:
Crimean War Quad: Tchernaya River - The Battle of Tractir Bridge, 15 August 1855

"Tchernaya River is a tactical level simulation of the battle that occurred between Russian troops and the combined forces of French and Sardinian troops alone the Tchernaya River on 15 August 1855. Each hexagon on the map represents 275 meters of real terrain from side to side and each Game-Turn represents 30 minutes of real time."


1 17" x 22" color map
with matte-finish back printed counters
26 Blue French
13 Light Blue Sardinian
47 Green Russians
10 Game Turn Non-Historic Scenario
15 Game Turn Historic Scenario
25437.name: Tchernaya River

25438.name: King Chip
25438.description:
King Chip: The Computer Game That Doesn't Require A Computer

1980's computer trivia for 1 to 6 players with 4050 questions and answers in 5 levels with the categories:

Data Communication
History & Current Events
Hardware
Jargon & Acronyms
Potpourri
Software

Includes a 'Certificate of Authenticity' assuring that this copy came from the first 10,000 game production run. This copy is No. 10,007!

Published in Markham, Ontario, Canada

25440.name: Flagships
25440.description:
Flagships is a naval strategy game requiring resolute and decisive action. To defeat the enemy, you must either sink his flagship or immobilize his fleet.

Flagships has one basic rule: ships may be sunk only by a superior force, either a single more powerful ship
attacking by right or a joint force of ships, one of equal power to the target ship attacking with the support of any other member of its fleet. No ship may ever sink a more powerful ship, even during group action.

Each player commands a fleet of nine warships: one flagship, two frigates, two sloops and four corvettes.
Only a flagship may sink the enemy flagship, and only if it has the required support.
Frigates, dominant in an open sea, can lose maneuverability as the fleets close for action.
Sloops, wayward and easily outflanked, can also be unreliable in support.
Corvettes, vulnerable at the outset, can determine the outcome of the closest battle.

Playing on a hexagonal shaped hex board of 37 hexagons, the two fleets are disposed as if sailing from opposite directions;
Each player in turn moves one piece in any permitted direction, moving from one hexagon to the next across their common dividing line. Lateral movements (north/south) are called movements abeam. Diagonal movements are called movements forward or astern

The various ships move as follows:
Flagship One space forward or astern or any number of spaces abeam
Frigate Any number of spaces forward, astern or abeam
Sloop Any number of spaces forward or astern, never abeam
Corvette Any number of spaces in an arc around any adjacent space

Sinking:
i) A ship is sunk by any enemy ship of superior power moving onto its space, and is removed from the board.

(ii) A ship may be sunk by any enemy ship of equal power moving onto its space, provided the
attacking ship is supported by another member of its fleet, the support ship being in a position
adjacent to the target vessel and on course to occupy its space.

(iii) No ship may sink a vessel of superior power, even during group action.

Support:
Support is only provided by vessels lying adjacent to the target vessel. Sloops may not support an attack while lying abeam of the target because they may neither move nor attack in that direction. Flagships may not support whilst disabled.

Disabling:
A flagship is disabled by any two enemy ships being in spaces adjacent to its own (even by sloops in positions abeam). Whilst disabled, a flagship may neither move, attack nor support an attack by any other vessel, but may form part of a cordon disabling the opposing flagship.

Winning:
Sink the enemy flagship or leave your opponent with no legal move.

25441.name: Feel Safe
25441.description:
From the publisher's website:

Welcome to the Department of Homeland Security shell game. Hand over your Rights and the DHS will protect you from the bad guys. Although the Department of Homeland Security cannot actually protect you from terrorists and random acts of violence, they sure can make it look like they’re doing something (or, in the face of hurricane Katrina, maybe not). A façade of security so you can feel safe (without actually being safe).

Feel Safe, The Game of Homeland Security is a satirical board game in which players start off with ten Rights (as per the Bill of Rights) and must exchange those Rights for perceived security and safety, the first player to lose or give away all of their Rights (in the name of national security) wins the game.

25442.name: Mulle Meck: bygger ett hus
25442.description: A Swedish roll & move game having to do with building a house. Nicely illustrated with high-quality box and board.

25443.name: Hot Tomato
25443.description: You win when you make the Hot Tomato jump across the play area and into the scoring tray. Win 8 rounds and you've won the game. Players make the Hot Tomato jump by pressing one of the five keys on their side.

25444.name: Bumps and Grinds
25444.description:
Bumps and Grinds

A hilarious drinking and stripping game.

(Any number can play)

For the first time here is an imaginative game whereby the rules require candle light and your favorite drinks. To create the proper atmosphere the game at first allows for more drinking due to various safety's but as Bumps and Grinds progresses and the first bashful blush is forgotten, more and more clothing is shed.

Hilarious situations are created when a player has to "Go Directly to Bar" or luckily draws a "False Modesty Card" as a temporary safety in lieu of removing one article of clothing.

When any one player is down to his or her last article of clothing and is about to lose that, he or she may blow out the candle and be declared the winner of Bumps and Grinds.

25445.name: Have U It?
25445.description: Players receive a green card with the sentence "Have U It?" on it and an equal amount of red counters. Each letter has a corresponding number next to it in red. The first player picks a card from the deck and checks to see if the letter and number coincide with his card. If it does, he places the card face-up in front of him If not, he calls out the combination and all players check their cards. The player who needs it takes the card.
